cleaned_text: In [Ayurveda](https://www.forestessentialsindia.com), some of the [natural ingredients](https://www.forestessentialsindia.com/blog/ingredients) or brightening herbs are known as Varnya herbs or Radiance Enhancing Herbs. These varnya herbs work on balancing Pitta dosha( [Read more](https://www.forestessentialsindia.com/the-brand#philosophy)), which is responsible for the manifestation of color in our upper layer of the skin (known as Avabhasini in Ayurveda). These herbs contain phytochemicals, which influence the functions of skin and provide nutrients necessary for healthy skin. Also Read - [Skincare Regime according to your Ayurvedic Doshas](https://www.forestessentialsindia.com/blog/skincare-regimes-according-to-your-ayurvedic-dosha.html) Also, the herbs from this category are largely Madhura, Tikt, Kashaya Rasa (sweet, bitter, astringent taste) and makes them apt for [balancing Pitta Dosha](https://www.forestessentialsindia.com/a-portrait-of-pitta) and detoxifying the blood, [skin toners ](https://www.forestessentialsindia.com/facial-care/toners.html) and complexion enhancers. Here are the top 5 Ayurvedic Skin Brighteners: Madhuyashthi It is also known as Madhuka or Licorice. Consistent use of Licorice helps to fade blemishes and dark spots. Integrating Licorice tea in the diet can protect the skin from the harmful UV rays. A Licorice root decoration can be used as a sunscreen lotion to protect the skin from sunburns and tan. You may apply a pack prepared by mixing the crushed [cucumber](https://www.forestessentialsindia.com/blog/ingredient/cucumber), fresh [turmeric](https://www.forestessentialsindia.com/blog/ingredient/turmeric) in Licorice tea to treat the sun damage. Manjistha- In ancient world, Manjistha is reputed as an efficient blood purifier, a Varnya herb and a Rasayan (rejuvenator) and hence it is extensively used in skin care from centuries. It retains moisture in the skin whilst helping to keep acne at bay.
